NovaTech  Solutions  Pvt.  Ltd.  -  HR  Policies  
& Em ployee  Handbook
Document Type: HR Policies & Employee Handbook Company Name: NovaTech Solutions 
Pvt. Ltd. Last Updated: 2025 Author: Manus AI
1. Working Hours & Attendance Policy
This policy outlines the standard working schedule and the expectations for employee 
attendance and remote work arrangements.
1.1 Standard Working Hours
The standard work week is Monday to Friday.
Day Start Time End Time Lunch Break
Monday - Friday 9:00 AM 5:00 PM1:00 PM ‒ 2:00 PM (1 
hour)
1.2 Attendance Rules
Employees are required to maintain consistent and punctual attendance.
•Daily Marking: Employees must mark their attendance daily using the designated 
biometric system or the HR portal.
•Late Arrivals: Repeated late arrival, deﬁned as more than three times in a calendar 
month, requires a written justiﬁcation to the immediate manager and Human 
Resources.
1.3 Remote Work
Employees have the ﬂexibility to request remote work for up to two days per month, 
subject to prior approval from their direct manager.
2. Leave Policy
NovaTech Solutions provides various types of paid leave to support the well-being and 
personal needs of its full-time employees.
2.1 Annual Leave (Vacation)
Entitlement Application Requirement
14 annual leaves per year Must be applied for at least 3 days in advance
2.2 Sick Leave
Employees are entitled to 8 paid sick leaves annually. Any sick leave extending beyond two 
consecutive days requires a valid medical certiﬁcate to be submitted to HR.
2.3 Casual Leave
Employees are granted 7 casual leaves per year, which are intended for urgent personal 
matters that cannot be planned in advance.
2.4 Parental Leave
Leave Type Duration Eligibility
Maternity Leave 12 weeks (paid) Female employees
Paternity Leave 7 days (paid) Male employees
3. Employee Conduct & Professionalism Policy
This section establishes the standards for professional behavior, dress code, and the 
responsible use of company assets.
3.1 Code of Conduct
All employees are expected to maintain the highest level of professionalism when 
interacting with colleagues, clients, and management. Harassment, discrimination, or 
abusive language is strictly prohibited and will result in disciplinary action, up to and 
including termination.
3.2 Dress Code
•Standard Attire: Smart casual attire is required during regular weekdays.
•Client Meetings: Formal dress is mandatory when attending meetings with clients or 
external partners.
3.3 Use of Company Devices
Company-provided laptops, phones, and other devices are to be used exclusively for oﬃcial 
work purposes. Unauthorized installation of software on company devices is strictly 
prohibited.
4. Data Protection & Conﬁdentiality Policy
NovaTech Solutions is committed to protecting its proprietary information and client data.
4.1 Conﬁdential Information
Employees have a fundamental obligation to protect all company data, client information, 
and internal documents from unauthorized disclosure.
4.2 Access Control
Employees must not share their passwords, security credentials, or access tokens with any 
other individual.
4.3 Data Sharing
Sharing any company data outside the organization requires explicit written approval from 
the relevant department head.
5. Workplace Ethics & Anti-Harassment Policy
5.1 Zero-Tolerance
The company maintains a zero-tolerance policy for all forms of harassment, bullying, and 
discrimination in the workplace.
5.2 Reporting Process
•Submission: Complaints can be submitted conﬁdentially to Human Resources via 
email or the dedicated HR portal.
•Investigation: HR will initiate an investigation into the complaint within seven working 
days of receipt.
•Conﬁdentiality: All complaints and subsequent investigations will be handled with the 
utmost conﬁdentiality.
6. Performance Evaluation Policy
6.1 Evaluation Cycle
Performance reviews are conducted twice per year to assess employee contributions and 
facilitate professional development.
6.2 Evaluation Criteria
Performance is evaluated based on the following key criteria:
•Productivity
•Attendance
•Teamwork
•Communication skills
•Skill growth and development
6.3 Reward & Recognition
High-performing employees may be eligible for various forms of recognition, including 
performance-based bonuses, certiﬁcates of achievement, and opportunities for promotion.
7. IT & Cybersecurity Policy
7.1 Acceptable Use
Employees must use the company's internet resources responsibly and avoid accessing 
harmful or insecure websites.
7.2 Email Security
Employees must exercise caution with email:
•Avoid opening unknown attachments.
•Do not share company data or conﬁdential information via personal email accounts.
7.3 Device Management
Any loss or theft of a company-provided device must be reported to the IT department 
within 24 hours.
8. Travel & Reimbursement Policy
8.1 Travel Eligibility
All business travel must be approved by the relevant manager prior to booking and 
departure.
8.2 Allowable Expenses
The following expenses are eligible for reimbursement:
•Transport costs
•Meals (up to a maximum of $25 per day)
•Hotel accommodation (standard rate)
•Internet charges incurred for business purposes
8.3 Claim Submission
Employees must submit all receipts and expense claims within ﬁve days of returning from 
the business trip.
9. Employee Beneﬁts Policy
NovaTech Solutions oﬀers a comprehensive beneﬁts package to its employees.
•Health Insurance: Comprehensive coverage is provided for the employee and their 
dependents.
•Bonuses: An annual bonus is awarded based on individual and company performance.
•Training & Learning: The company sponsors one relevant professional development 
course for each employee every six months.
10. Termination & Resignation Policy
10.1 Resignation Notice
A minimum of 30 days' written notice is required for all employee resignations.
10.2 Exit Process
Upon separation from the company, employees must:
•Return all company belongings (e.g., laptop, ID badge).
•An experience letter will be issued within 14 days following the last day of employment.
10.3 Termination Reasons
Employment may be terminated due to reasons including, but not limited to, misconduct, 
repeated policy violations, or consistently poor performance.
